title: (x) Monadnock Region elegant script - Vivaldi {Patricia}
content:
Hello,

I need a hand in identifying the font in the attached jpg.

Thanks,  
Émilie

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [monadnockregion.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014225128/http:/typophile.com/files/monadnockregion.jpg) | 15.06 KB |
author: emilie

comments.content:
Vivaldi

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/vivaldi/ef/testdrive.html?s=Monadnock+Re...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014225128/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/vivaldi/ef/testdrive.html?s=Monadnock+Region&p=48 "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/vivaldi/ef/testdrive.html?s=Monadnock+Region&p=48")

Not all versions have this lower case g.

Dunno why this link isn't working...

_Dunno why this link isn’t working…_

Maybe because it points to a type vendor that _doesn't_ support the Typophile Type Identification Board? :-D

In my own defense: I linked to Myfonts instead of Fontshop because, quite frankly, Fontshop doesn't have the keyword search. I recognized the font but it wasn't on the tip of my tongue. Doing a search for "Calligraphic" at myfonts turned it right up. And then I'm just not going to take the time to go to a whole other site for the link. So.... if Fontshop could remedy this discrepancy, we'd be in business.

No need to get defensive, I was just pulling yo' leg. :-)

I think the keyword search is being looked into at FontShop.
Now will you give me credit for the id???
